definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to beat the gong to open a performance
to beat the gong to clear the way/(fig.) to pave the way for sth
lit. to beat a gong; fig. to irritate sb/a provocation
to strike the edge of the gong/(fig.) to stir the pot (i.e. cause or exacerbate a dispute)
the final bell (esp. in sports competition)

sentences.english: And this is "Da Luo", it is a big gong.
sentences.chinese: 這個叫“大鑼”，是鑼的一種。

sentences.english: The main part of the paper is divided into four chapters: Chapter I is the body research of EZhou-Paiziluo.
sentences.chinese: 第一章爲鄂州牌子鑼本體研究。

sentences.english: We must always be wary of those who with sounding brass and a tinkling cymbal preach the "ism" of appeasement.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須警惕那些敲着鑼打着鼓宣傳緩和主義的分子。
